name: Fotomoto
description: Sell photos online on your website
overview:
Fotomoto is an e-commerce system specifically designed for photos. If you are a photographer or you operate a website with a big photo inventory, Fotomoto helps you monetize your photos and sell them in a professional way – on your own website. You will sell without any hassle.

Fotomoto takes care of everything: processing order right on your website, processing the payment, making a print (or other products), and shipping it to the customers. Our goal is to let photographers and content owners focus on their photography without worrying about the hassles of selling.

funding_rounds.source_description: Fotomoto Lands $1.2 Million, Helps Its Clients Sell Images Online In A Flash

milestones.description: Fotomoto Signs Up 150 Photographers In Two Weeks For Instant Photo Commerce Service
milestones.source_text:
SAN FRANCISCO, California (May 7, 2009) â€“ Within two weeks of launching in closed beta on April
12th, Fotomoto, a service that enables photographers to sell images on their own websites, passed the
150-customer mark.
Photographers and organizations that own or aggregate photos often find the amount of effort required
to sell photos rather frustrating. While creating photo websites has become easy, adding e-commerce
and professional fulfillment to such websites is still a challenge. The only existing solution, selling via
generic photo store websites, contradicts the branding and artistic identity of one's own website.
With Fotomoto, photography websites can instantly attach a "Buy Now" button to all of their sellable
photos. The button â€œknowsâ€ the pricing and availability of the photos, and keeps track of photo
editions. It allows visitors to easily place orders for photos without leaving the website.
â€œPersonally, I'm really excited by this as it will allow us to provide high-quality prints, to a world-wide
audience, in a much simpler way than previously." said photographer David J. Nightingale, whose
website, www.chromasia.com, is viewed by more than 150,000 unique visitors every month.
In addition to prints, Fotomoto is planning to offer postcards, calendars, photo licensing, and
merchandise. As the New York Times has observed, â€œthis could turn the industry on its headâ€ by
removing the middleman and empowering photography websites to sell directly:
ï¬ The service can be customized to blend into any website, and takes just a few clicks to install.
ï¬ Fotomoto receives, fulfills, and ships the orders on behalf of the site owner.
ï¬ Site owners have full control over the pricing of their photos.
ï¬ Fotomoto automatically manages their photos, editions, sales, and customer lists for them.
ï¬ Organizations and galleries can share revenues with their photographers via Fotomoto.
â€œThe reaction has been overwhelming.â€ said Ahmad Kiarostami, CEO and co-founder. â€œPhotographers
have been looking for a solution that would not make them sell their art at online photo supermarkets.
Fotomoto allows them to maintain their online artistic brand, and sell directly to their audience. The
volume of requests to use Fotomoto is staggering, coming literally from all over the world.â€
Fotomoto has partnered up with best-in-class printing facilities for premium quality prints, and delivers
orders internationally.
About Fotomoto
Fotomoto enables photographers, magazines, blogs, non-profit organizations, news agencies, and sports
and celebrity websites to sell photos on their own websites. Using Fotomoto, any individual or
organization with photo content can sell photo-based products without sending their customers to thirdparty
websites. To find out more please visit www.fotomoto.com.
Contact
info@fotomoto.com
(415) 365-6226
milestones.source_description: Fotomoto Signs Up 150 Photographers In Two Weeks For Instant Photo Commerce Service
